title: Former SJB councillor arrested over narcotics seized from fishing boat
byline: A former Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) member of the Pannala Pradeshiya Sabha has been arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB).

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central and Eastern provinces, today (21), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Over 375kg of heroin, ‘Ice’ and 2 firearms seized from fishing vessel intercepted off southern coast
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized a large haul of narcotics, including 261 kilograms of crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) and 115 kilograms of heroin, along with a revolver, a pistol, and a magazine from the multi-day fishing vessel intercepted off the southern coast.

title: Four more arrested in India over deadly Delhi blast
byline: India’s anti-terrorism agency said on Thursday (Nov 20) it had arrested four more people, including three doctors, in connection with last week’s deadly car blast in Delhi, the first such attack in the heavily-guarded capital in more than a decade.

title: White House defends Trump calling a female reporter ‘piggy’
byline: The White House on Thursday defended President Donald Trump after he called a female reporter “piggy” as she questioned him about the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, saying the president’s remarks reflected his frankness and transparency.

title: Mexico’s Fatima Bosch crowned Miss Universe winner in glittering finale of scandal-hit pageant
byline: Fatima Bosch of Mexico has been named Miss Universe 2025 in a scandal-hit competition where she emerged as a fan favorite after she was berated by a Thai pageant director during a live-streamed meeting, triggering a walk out by contestants.

title: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe departs for India
byline: Former President and UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe left for Chennai, India, this morning (21) from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, airport officials confirmed.

title: Woman dies, teenage son injured in acid attack in Ayagama
byline: A 40-year-old woman has died following an acid attack on her and her 16-year-old son in the Kolabewa area, within the Ayagama Police Division.

title: One of world’s largest passenger aircraft makes emergency landing at BIA
byline: Emirates flight EK-434, en route from Dubai to Brisbane, Australia, has made an emergency landing at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake last night.

title: Father and son seek Rs. 100M in compensation for wrongful arrest by police during ‘Yukthiya’
byline: The Supreme Court has granted leave to proceed with a fundamental rights petition filed by a father and son seeking Rs. 100 million in compensation for the alleged violation of their fundamental rights by officers of the Grandpass Police Station.

title: Ex-President Ranil says ‘Aragalaya’ was suppressed democratically
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that the ‘Aragalaya’ protest movement in Sri Lanka were suppressed through democratic means.

title: ‘Black Panther’ star Chadwick Boseman honored with Hollywood star
byline: “Black Panther” star Chadwick Boseman was posthumously honored on Thursday with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

title: Four Additional Solicitors General appointed President’s Counsel
byline: Four newly promoted Additional Solicitors General of the Attorney General’s Department have been appointed as President’s Counsel.

title: MP Archchuna alleges death threats in Parliament Cafeteria
byline: Jaffna District Member of Parliament Ramanathan Archchuna has alleged that a Puttalam District MP of the National People’s Power (NPP) made death threats against him at the Parliament cafeteria today (21).

title: Death toll from Indonesia’s Central Java landslides rises to 30
byline: The death toll from landslides in two regions of Indonesia’s Central Java rose to 30 as rescue efforts continued, the country’s disaster mitigation agency said on Friday.

title: 16 passengers killed after night bus plunges off bridge in Cambodia
byline: A passenger bus in Cambodia crashed off a bridge into a river, killing at least 16 passengers and injuring two dozen others, police said.

title: Appeals Court upholds death sentence on five over 2019 drug charges
byline: The Court of Appeal today (21) upheld the death sentence imposed on five defendants convicted of transporting over 152 kilograms of heroin along the southern coast in 2019, by the Colombo High Court.

title: Fire disrupts COP30 climate talks as UN chief urges deal
byline: Talks at the COP30 climate summit in Brazil were disrupted on Thursday after a fire broke out in the venue, triggering an evacuation just as negotiators were hunkering down to try to land a deal to strengthen international climate efforts.

title: SriLankan Airlines and govt reach agreement in principle with bondholders on bond restructuring
byline: SriLankan Airlines and the Government of Sri Lanka have reached an agreement in principle with major bondholders on the restructuring of USD 175 million in Guaranteed Bonds due June 2024, subject to the approval by the Cabinet, IMF, and the Official Creditor Committee (OCC).

title: At least 41 dead as relentless rains flood Vietnam
byline: Relentless rains and floods have killed at least 41 people in central Vietnam since the weekend, while a search continues for nine still missing, state media reported.

title: SJB suspends membership of ex-Pannala PS member arrested over narcotics seizure
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has suspended the party membership of the former SJB member of the Pannala Pradeshiya Sabha, who was arrested in connection with the seizure of the narcotics haul from a fishing vessel off the southern coast yesterday (20).

title: One person killed in accident at Hanguranketha
byline: A woman has reportedly died in an accident that occurred this morning (21) in the ‘Hulan Wanguwa’ area of Hanguranketha, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Over 1,400kg of narcotics seized so far under ‘Nation United’ island-wide operation
byline: A large quantity of narcotics has been seized thus far under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign, launched on October 30, aimed at eradicating the drug menace from the country.

title: Australia adds Amazon’s Twitch to teen social media ban, spares Pinterest
byline: Australia’s internet watchdog on Friday said it would include Amazon.com-owned live streaming service Twitch in its upcoming teen social media ban, but will not add image-sharing platform Pinterest to the list.

title: School cut-off marks of 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship exam released
byline: The school cut-off marks for the admission of students to Grade 06 of schools based on the results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination have been released online by the Ministry of Education.

title: “Maha Jana Handa” joint opposition rally begins in Nugegoda
byline: The “Maha Jana Handa” public rally, organized by several opposition parties in protest against the government, has commenced today (21) at the Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre in Nugegoda.

title: NPP-held Soranathota PS budget defeated for second time
byline: The 2026 budget of the Soranathota Pradeshiya Sabha, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated for the second time today (21) by a margin of one vote.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Alleged shooter & other suspects further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the further remand of a group of suspects, including the alleged shooter, arrested in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’, until December 05.

title: Police remove loudspeakers installed outside Nugegoda rally venue
byline: The “Maha Jana Handa” public rally, organized by several opposition parties in protest against the government, is scheduled to commence today (21) at the Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre in Nugegoda.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation rises to 2.7% in October 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) on a year-on-year basis, increased to 2.7% in October 2025, compared to 2.1% in September 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Wax Diana in ‘revenge dress’ is unveiled in Paris decades after her death in the city
byline: Princess Diana returned to Paris in wax Thursday as one of Europe’s oldest wax museums unveiled a new figure of the British royal in the so-called “revenge dress,” decades after her tragic death in the city.

title: Magnitude 5.7 earthquake jolts Bangladesh, killing three
byline: At least three people were killed and several injured after a magnitude 5.7 earthquake struck Bangladesh on Friday, police said, with buildings damaged in many areas including Dhaka, the densely populated capital.

title: Gunmen kidnap 52 students from school in Nigeria
byline: Nigeria suffered its second mass school abduction this week with authorities confirming an attack on a Catholic school in the conflict-battered northern region of the country on Friday.

title: 18 dead in Pakistan glue factory explosion amid safety concerns
byline: A boiler at a glue-making factory in eastern Pakistan exploded on Friday, killing at least 18 people and injuring 21 others. The force of the blast destroyed the factory building and damaged several nearby homes, igniting a huge fire and spreading panic through the area, officials said.

title: Sri Lanka’s Deputy FM holds bilateral talks with EU’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra, met with the High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy and Vice-President of the European Commission, Kaja Kallas in Brussels.

title: Train services resume on up-country railway line as tracks restored
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has confirmed that the obstructions that existed on the up-country railway line has now been cleared, and the tracks on the line have been restored to a condition suitable for train operations.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several districts extended
byline: Early landslide warning issued for several areas in seven districts of the island owing to the prevailing heavy rain, have been extended.

title: 25 Police Inspectors including several OICs transferred with immediate effect
byline: Twenty-five Inspector Rank police officers, including several Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of police stations and divisions, have been transferred with immediate effect, according to the National Police Commission (NPC).

title: Indian combat aircraft crashes during demonstration at Dubai Air Show
byline: A combat plane crashed Friday during a demonstration at the Dubai Air Show.

title: India and Sri Lanka hold talks on boosting interoperability, deepening defence ties
byline: India and Sri Lanka held the 11th Army-to-Army Staff Talks (AAST) in Bihar’s Bodhgaya, identifying key areas to boost interoperability and deepening the broader defence partnership.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan agree to continue close bilateral collaboration
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of Pakistan Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar on Friday met with Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment of Sri Lanka, Arun Hemachandra, on the sidelines of the 4th EU Indo-Pacific Ministerial Forum being held from 20-21 November 2025 in Brussels.
